de.esoco.lib.mapping

Interface MethodDatatypeMapper

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericMethodDatatypeMapper

    public interface MethodDatatypeMapper
    Interface that defines the mapping of certain datatypes of method parameters. Implementations should normally work in both ways, i.e. it should be possible to convert the result of one mapping back to the original type with another call to one of the mapping methods. Accordingly, appliesTo() should return TRUE for both types.

    Each method call has two arguments, the method that has been invoked and the datatype or value to map. Implementations that provide a global mapping of datatypes can ignore the method parameter and simply map each occurence of a covered datatype. The method argument allows to limit the mapping to certain methods or to map datatypes differently for different methods.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean appliesTo(java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod, java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype)
      Checks if this mapper applies to a particular datatype.
      java.lang.Class<?> mapType(java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod, java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype)
      Maps the argument datatype into another type.
      java.lang.Object mapValue(java.lang.Object rTarget, java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod, java.lang.Object rValue)
      Maps the argument value into another type.

    • Method Detail

      • appliesTo

        boolean appliesTo(java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod,
                  java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype)
        Checks if this mapper applies to a particular datatype. This method must return TRUE for all datatypes that are covered by this mapper.
        Parameters:
        rOriginalMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rDatatype - The datatype to check
        Returns:
        TRUE if this mapper should be used to map parameters of the given type

      • mapType

        java.lang.Class<?> mapType(java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod,
                           java.lang.Class<?> rDatatype)
        Maps the argument datatype into another type. This should normally be implemented both ways, i.e. the mapped type should also be a valid argument to this method.
        Parameters:
        rOriginalMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rDatatype - The datatype to map
        Returns:
        The converted type

      • mapValue

        java.lang.Object mapValue(java.lang.Object rTarget,
                          java.lang.reflect.Method rOriginalMethod,
                          java.lang.Object rValue)
        Maps the argument value into another type. The actual value itself should normally not be modified (at least not more than necessary for the new type). This should normally be implemented both ways, i.e. the mapped value should also be a valid argument to this method.
        Parameters:
        rTarget - The target object of the method call
        rOriginalMethod - The original method that has been invoked
        rValue - The value to map the datatype of
        Returns:
        The converted value
